security: This message discusses the briefing of the President on Cuban subversion and the use of defectors, indicating a sensitive political operation. It also mentions security breaches and the potential incompetence of local police, which could compromise ongoing intelligence efforts. "Station WILL see CHANCE to demonstrate to RIVERA that Police IS INCOMPETENT."
summary: A message from San Salvador to the Director, expressing satisfaction with the briefing given to the President on Cuban subversion, but also concern over security breaches and the competence of local police.
summary_one_paragraph: On September 8, 1964, a SECRET message was sent from the CIA station in San Salvador to the Director, with information copies to WHP, DOP, and others. The message, referencing SALV 5238, expresses satisfaction with the effective presentation of a briefing to President concerning Cuban subversion and the use of defectors, but notes concern over security breaches and the competence of the local police. The message suggests the station will use this as an opportunity to demonstrate to Rivera the incompetence of the police force.
title: Message Regarding Briefing to President on Cuban Subversion
